definition: dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: How did I manage to walk away from a Chinese tea party 853 yuan lighter?
sentences.chinese: 我如何管理自己步行一中茶话会八五三元打火机了？

sentences.english: You can organise tea parties in honor of your mother on a Mothers Day。
sentences.chinese: 母亲节那天你可以“以母之名”举办一场茶话会。

sentences.english: They showed the old lady numerous little attentions at the tea party.
sentences.chinese: 在茶话会上他们对那位老太太百般殷勤。

sentences.english: They have a tea party and astounding resolutions roll past.
sentences.chinese: 他们开着茶话会，天雷提案滚滚来。

sentences.english: You can organise tea parties in honor of your mother on a Mothers Day.
sentences.chinese: 母亲节那天你可以“以母之名”举办一场茶话会。

sentences.english: You can organise tea of your mother on a Mothers Day.
sentences.chinese: 母亲节那天你可以“以母之名”举行一场茶话会。

sentences.english: Or an old fashioned tea party?
sentences.chinese: 或者来个老式的茶话会。

sentences.english: There is no happy reconciliatory tea party or some such at the end.
sentences.chinese: 没有快乐协调的茶话会或类似这样的结尾。

sentences.english: You can organize tea parties in respect of your mom upon the Mothers Day.
sentences.chinese: 母亲节那天你可以“以母之名”举办一场茶话会。

sentences.english: Each boy and each girl has been invited to the tea-party.
sentences.chinese: 每个男孩和每个女孩都被邀请参加茶话会了。

definition: social gathering at which those attending take it in turns to perform for the whole group (music, dancing or comedy etc)
team building (abbr. for 團隊建設|团队建设[tuan2 dui4 jian4 she4])/building camaraderie within the Chinese Communist Youth League 中國共產主義青年團|中国共产主义青年团[Zhong1 guo2 Gong4 chan3 zhu3 yi4 Qing1 nian2 tuan2]
communal meal/formal dinner of club or group
to hold a meeting/to attend a meeting
